turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bo Callaway.
turn.2: Callaway died at an assisted living facility in Columbus, Georgia, on March 15, 2014, of complications of a cerebral hemorrhage suffered two years prior.
turn.6: His wife, Laura Elizabeth "Beth" Walton Callaway (1926–2009), a native of Hamilton in Harris County, Georgia, was a daughter of Ralph Outlaw Walton and the former Octavia Perry.
turn.8: She met Howard Callaway in the sixth grade.
turn.10: A chemist and a graduate of Agnes Scott College in Atlanta, the couple married in 1949 and was together for more than sixty years until her death.
turn.12: In 1979, she received a Master of Science in Botany from Western State College in Gunnison, Colorado.
